intro: Jussiaea pulvinaris, commonly known as the velvetleaf or swamp hibiscus, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along waterways, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering period usually occurs during the warm seasons, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Jussiaea pulvinaris plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
